data.enText: a type of music with strong rhythms, in which the players often improvise (= make up the music as they are playing) , originally created by African American musicians

data.chText: 以及诸如此类的东西（或事情）

data.enText: How's it going? You know─love, life and all that jazz.
data.chText: 怎么样啊？你知道——说的就是爱情、生活以及诸如此类的事情嘛。

data.enText: to make sth more interesting, exciting or attractive
data.chText: 使某事更有趣；使某事更令人兴奋；使某事更有吸引力

data.enText: to make a piece of music sound more modern, or more like popular music or jazz
data.chText: 使一段音乐听起来更现代化；使更具有流行音乐（或爵士乐）的风格

data.enText: It's a jazzed up version of an old tune.
data.chText: 这是把一段古老的曲调翻新了。

data.enText: to make sth more interesting, exciting or attractive
data.chText: 使某事更有趣；使某事更令人兴奋；使某事更有吸引力

data.enText: to make a piece of music sound more modern, or more like popular music or jazz
data.chText: 使一段音乐听起来更现代化；使更具有流行音乐（或爵士乐）的风格

data.enText: It's a jazzed up version of an old tune.
data.chText: 这是把一段古老的曲调翻新了。

trans: 使更有趣；使更绚丽多彩；使更令人兴奋
使更具流行音乐（或爵士乐）风格

data.chText: 以及诸如此类的东西（或事情）

data.enText: How's it going? You know─love, life and all that jazz.
data.chText: 怎么样啊？你知道——说的就是爱情、生活以及诸如此类的事情嘛。

tr: a style of dance music popular in the 1920s
similar to New Orleans jazz but played by large bands
a genre of popular music that originated in New Orleans around 1900 and developed through increasingly complex styles
empty rhetoric or insincere or exaggerated talk
example: don't give me any of that jazz
This student sleeps with everyone in her dorm
Were you ever intimate with this man?

tr: play something in the style of jazz

example.ex: The pub has live jazz on Sundays.
example.tran: 那家酒馆每周日都有现场爵士乐演奏。

example.ex: ...the great American jazz pianist George Shearing.
example.tran: 美国伟大的爵士乐钢琴演奏家乔治·希林

value.def: Jazz is a style of music that was invented by African American musicians in the early part of the twentieth century. Jazz music has very strong rhythms and often involves improvisation.
